titleStmt.title: William Carroll et al. to Richard T. Jacob
CWG6976

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency
Lt Gov R. T. Jacob=Acting Gov.
Dr Sir

Mr A. S. Taylor was in the year 1864 was recognized to appear as a witness for the commonwealth in the Ballard Circuit Court in a proceeding then therein pending against one McCawley charged with permitting gaming in his house=Mr Taylor failed to appear in Said court and his recognizance was forfeited=Execution has been issued upon it -- Mr Taylor was on a/c of the disturbed condition of the country at that time unable to attend said court, and could not have attended without great peril, he having been, while a resident of said county conscripted into the rebel service, and having escaped from them was apprehensive of again falling into their hands=We the undersigned in view of the above facts respectfully ask your Excellency to remit the forfeiture aforesd and we will ever pray &c

William Carroll Atty at Law
James Hesswood P M
John W Morlan
W Penn
E M. Taylor
John T Rodman
B. Will
J W, Clayton
G, B. Moore
W M Waide
W, G, Willett
Ramsey M Harwood
Robert Brown
F, B, Hitt
Jno. Milton
A. W,illiams
Arch C Mahan
D C.. Wood
A, R, Mullen
J, M, Fitzgerald
J, W, Russell
H,, Williams. Jr
Jno A Morris R R Agent
Nicholas Kelley
T, A, Rodman county Judge
William H Talbott
T. J. Bain,
E F Talyor

Ballard Cir Ct
vs.
Remit
A S. Taylor
$100
28th Sept/65
